Generation I.Red: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
Generation I.Yellow: If you touch the feeler on top of its head, it will release a horrible stink to protect itself.
Generation I.Stadium: It has large, eye-like patterns on its head as protection. They are used to frighten off enemies.

Generation II.Gold: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
Generation II.Silver: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.
Generation II.Crystal: It crawls into foliage where it camouflages itself among leaves that are the same color as its body.
Generation II.Stadium 2: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this Pok é mon releases a terrifically strong odor.

Generation III.FireRed: It is covered with a green skin. When it grows, it sheds the skin, covers itself with silk, and becomes a cocoon.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

Generation VII.Sun: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
Generation VII.Moon: It's easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making it one of the top recommendations for novice Pokémon Trainers.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its body is soft and weak. In nature, its perpetual fate is to be seen by others as food.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: If you touch the feeler on top of its head, it will release a horrible stink to protect itself.
